timeline.author: 1-alex98

timeline.bodyText: Could we maybe test this method with a real replay :D Then we would solve this issue forever
timeline.author: 1-alex98
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -513,14 +513,14 @@ private void runFafReplayFile(Path path) throws IOException {
 
     // For some reason in the coop replay the map name is null in the metadata

replies.bodyText: Do you mean just get the map name from the replay data for all maps?
replies.author: Sheikah45

replies.bodyText: I made a change assuming that is what you meant
replies.author: Sheikah45

replies.bodyText: Was absolutely not what I meant XD I meant write a unit test
replies.author: 1-alex98

replies.bodyText: Concerning what u did I don't know if that's a good idea. No idea what pros and cons are too that
replies.author: 1-alex98

replies.bodyText: Maybe @micheljung @Wesmania know what pros and cons are about reading the map from the replay file or the replayInfo stored in the databse.
replies.author: 1-alex98

replies.bodyText:
It's the right thing to do for randomized maps, since these will never be stored in the DB. The coop map issue is here: FAForever/server#372
I don't know which is right for all the rest tbh.
replies.author: Wesmania

replies.bodyText: I tested it and it worked for maps in the vault as well. I think an issue would arise if for some reason the map in the lua header was different than the vault or if the map table structure is intended to be changed. Also I believe the replayinfo that is being read here is stored in the replay file as well just it is the part in the faf header vs the lua header.
replies.author: Sheikah45

replies.bodyText: Hmm well I mean if it works better let's do it this way right.
replies.author: 1-alex98

timeline.message:
Fix coop replay parsing

Reads in mapName from replay bytes if game type is coop.
Updates FAF to correct version for replay.
Parse replay bytes for map name for all replays
Parse replay bytes for map name for all replays
